description: This operation returns the time series data collected by a Contributor Insights rule. The data includes the identity and number of contributors to the log group. You can also optionally return one or more statistics about each data point in the time series. These statistics can include the following:

parameters.name: RuleName
parameters.description: The name of the rule that you want to see data from.

parameters.name: StartTime
parameters.description: The start time of the data to use in the report. When used in a raw HTTP Query API, it is formatted as yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss. For example, 2019-07-01T23:59:59.

parameters.name: EndTime
parameters.description: The end time of the data to use in the report. When used in a raw HTTP Query API, it is formatted as yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss. For example, 2019-07-01T23:59:59.

parameters.name: Period
parameters.description: The period, in seconds, to use for the statistics in the InsightRuleMetricDatapoint results.

parameters.name: Metrics
parameters.description: Specifies which metrics to use for aggregation of contributor values for the report. You can specify one or more of the following metrics: UniqueContributors --- the number of unique contributors for each data point. MaxContributorValue --- the value of the top contributor for each data point. The identity of the contributor might change for each data point in the graph. If this rule aggregates by COUNT, the top contributor for each data point is the contributor with the most occurrences in that period. If the rule aggregates by SUM, the top contributor is the contributor with the highest sum in the log field specified by the rule's Value, during that period. SampleCount --- the number of data points matched by the rule. Sum --- the sum of the values from all contributors during the time period represented by that data point. Minimum --- the minimum value from a single observation during the time period represented by that data point. Maximum --- the maximum value from a single observation during the time period represented by that data point. Average --- the average value from all contributors during the time period represented by that data point. (string) ---

nested_items.name: KeyLabels
nested_items.description: An array of the strings used as the keys for this rule. The keys are the dimensions used to classify contributors. If the rule contains more than one key, then each unique combination of values for the keys is counted as a unique contributor.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AggregationStatistic
nested_items.description: Specifies whether this rule aggregates contributor data by COUNT or SUM.

nested_items.name: AggregateValue
nested_items.description: The sum of the values from all individual contributors that match the rule.

nested_items.name: ApproximateUniqueCount
nested_items.description: An approximate count of the unique contributors found by this rule in this time period.

nested_items.name: Contributors
nested_items.description: An array of the unique contributors found by this rule in this time period. If the rule contains multiple keys, each combination of values for the keys counts as a unique contributor.

nested_items.name: Keys
nested_items.description: One of the log entry field keywords that is used to define contributors for this rule.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ApproximateAggregateValue
nested_items.description: An approximation of the aggregate value that comes from this contributor.

nested_items.name: Datapoints
nested_items.description: An array of the data points where this contributor is present. Only the data points when this contributor appeared are included in the array.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp of the data point.

nested_items.name: ApproximateValue
nested_items.description: The approximate value that this contributor added during this timestamp.

nested_items.name: MetricDatapoints
nested_items.description: A time series of metric data points that matches the time period in the rule request.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp of the data point.

nested_items.name: UniqueContributors
nested_items.description: The number of unique contributors who published data during this timestamp.

nested_items.name: MaxContributorValue
nested_items.description: The maximum value provided by one contributor during this timestamp. Each timestamp is evaluated separately, so the identity of the max contributor could be different for each timestamp.

nested_items.name: SampleCount
nested_items.description: The number of occurrences that matched the rule during this data point.

nested_items.name: Average
nested_items.description: The average value from all contributors during the time period represented by that data point.

nested_items.name: Sum
nested_items.description: The sum of the values from all contributors during the time period represented by that data point.

nested_items.name: Minimum
nested_items.description: The minimum value from a single contributor during the time period represented by that data point.

nested_items.name: Maximum
nested_items.description: The maximum value from a single occurence from a single contributor during the time period represented by that data point.
